main event: Ground observation of a bright light in the sky observed on 25 August 1955.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes,The witnesses reported that the light appeared to slow down perceptibly at about 100MPH,The target was noted to be extremely bright before fading and reappearing numerous times,There were issues with tracking the target on radar as it would appear to make maneuvers beyond the observers' capability to track,The incident was classified with various conclusions about the nature of the object including balloon or aircraft possibilities.
sighted object: One bright light in the sky
witness description: Cliver John R. - 1st Lt. Director, Bobsick J.L. - A/2C Radar Operator, Icing Isaac N. - A/2C Radar Operator
